events.originalText: Protests in Santiago that started 11 days prior escalated into open battle against the Chilean national police, forcing President Sebastián Piñera to declare a state of emergency.
events.subtitle: Santiago
events.headline: Protests in Santiago escalate into open battle against Chilean police, President Piñera declares state of emergency

events.originalText: At the Summer Olympics in Mexico City, American athlete Bob Beamon (pictured) achieved a distance of 8.90 m (29.2 ft) in the long jump event, setting a world record that stood for 23 years.
events.subtitle: 1968 Summer Olympics
events.headline: American athlete Bob Beamon sets world record in long jump at Summer Olympics in Mexico City

events.originalText: The Soviet space probe Venera 4 became the first spacecraft to perform direct in situ analysis of the environment of another planet (Venus).
events.subtitle: Venera 4
events.headline: Soviet space probe Venera 4 performs first direct in situ analysis of Venus

events.originalText: The first cat in space, later known as Félicette, launched aboard a French Véronique rocket.
events.subtitle: Félicette
events.headline: First cat in space launched aboard French Véronique rocket

events.originalText: Renton defeated Kilmarnock 2–0 in the opening match of the inaugural Scottish Cup.
events.subtitle: Renton F.C.
events.headline: Renton defeats Kilmarnock 2–0 in inaugural Scottish Cup match

events.originalText: American Revolutionary War: In an act of retaliation against ports that supported Patriot activities in the early stages of the war, the Royal Navy destroyed what is now Portland, Maine.
events.subtitle: American Revolutionary War
events.headline: Royal Navy destroys Portland, Maine in retaliation during American Revolutionary War

events.originalText: The War of the Austrian Succession ended with the signing of the Treaty of Aix-la-Chapelle.
events.subtitle: War of the Austrian Succession
events.headline: War of the Austrian Succession ends with Treaty of Aix-la-Chapelle

events.originalText: Filipino sailors disembarked from the Manila galleon Nuestra Señora de Buena Esperanza in what is now Morro Bay, California, the first documented instance of Asians in the Americas.
events.subtitle: Filipinos
events.headline: Filipino sailors disembark in Morro Bay, California, first documented instance of Asians in Americas

events.originalText: The first recorded naval battle between Europeans and the Japanese occurred when a flotilla of samurai attacked two Portuguese trade vessels at the Battle of Fukuda Bay in Nagasaki.
events.subtitle: Samurai
events.headline: First recorded naval battle between Europeans and Japanese at Battle of Fukuda Bay in Nagasaki

events.originalText: The most significant earthquake to have occurred in Central Europe in recorded history destroyed Basel, Switzerland.
events.subtitle: 1356 Basel earthquake
events.headline: Significant earthquake destroys Basel, Switzerland in Central Europe

events.originalText: Byzantine–Norman wars: Robert Guiscard led an invasion of the Byzantine Empire, capturing Dyrrhachium in present-day Albania.
events.subtitle: Byzantine–Norman wars
events.headline: Robert Guiscard captures Dyrrhachium in Byzantine–Norman wars invasion

events.originalText: Pappus of Alexandria, one of the last great Greek mathematicians of antiquity, observed an eclipse that allowed historians to calculate the approximate dates of his life.
events.subtitle: Pappus of Alexandria
events.headline: Pappus of Alexandria observes eclipse, allowing historians to calculate approximate dates of his life
